titles.title: Expressing support for designation of the week of April 18, 2010, through April 23, 2010, as National Assistant Principals Week.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and Labor

action.text: Ms. Woolsey moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1131.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 411 - 0 (Roll no. 224).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education
committee.name: House Education and Labor

bill.summary: 4/27/2010--Passed House amended. Supports the designation of National Assistant Principals Week. Honors the contributions of assistant principals to the success of students in schools.
